source_sentence: 爾時釋提桓因、梵天王、自在天王，及眾生主、諸天女等，皆大歡喜，同時三唱：「快哉，快哉！
translation: It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra, the Brahma Heavenly Kings, the Śubha Heavenly Kings, the lords of sentient beings, and the goddesses all rejoiced greatly and sang three times at the same time, "How wonderful, how wonderful!

source_sentence: 佛出世故，須菩提乃能演說是法。」
translation: It's because the Buddha appeared in the world that Subhūti was able to expound this teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時諸天大眾俱白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the great multitude of gods all said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若菩薩能不離般若波羅蜜行，當視是人如佛。」
translation: If a bodhisattva can practice without departing from prajñā-pāramitā, he will regard this person as a Buddha."

source_sentence: 佛告諸天子：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha told the celestials, "So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 昔我於眾華城燃燈佛所，不離般若波羅蜜行。
translation: In the past, I didn't stop practicing prajñā-pāramitā at the Burning Lamp Buddha's place in the City of Many Flowers.

source_sentence: 時燃燈佛記我於來世，過阿僧祇劫，當得作佛，號釋迦牟尼如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。」
translation: The Dīpaṃkara Buddha then predicted that in a future life, after an incalculably long eon, I would become a buddha, to be called Śākyamuni the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Tamer of Beings, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One."

source_sentence: 諸天子白佛言：「希有，世尊！
translation: The celestials said to the Buddha, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸菩薩摩訶薩般若波羅蜜能攝取薩婆若。」
translation: The bodhisattvas, the great wisdom and perfection of wisdom are able to gather sarvajñas."

source_sentence: 佛因釋提桓因，告欲色界諸天子及四眾比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷等：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha told the gods of the desire realm and the four groups of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen in the form realm because of Śakra Devānām-Indra, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，能受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行，魔若魔天，人若非人，不得其便，終不橫死。
translation: "If there are good men and good women who can retain and recite the perfection of wisdom and do as described, māras and gods, humans and non-humans alike, won't get an advantage over them, and they'll never die horribly.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜故；忉利諸天發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，未受持讀誦般若波羅蜜者，來至其所。
translation: Good sons and good women who memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom and come to the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials because they've aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and haven't memorized and recited the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 復次，憍尸迦！
translation: Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜時，若在空舍，若在道路，若或失道，無有恐怖。」
translation: Good sons and good women, when you memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom, if you're in an empty house or on a road, or if you lose your way, there's no fear."

source_sentence: 爾時四天王白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the four heavenly kings said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行，我等皆當護念。」
translation: If good men and good women memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom and perform it as described, we will all guard and remember them."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānāmī said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行，我當護念。」
translation: If good sons and good women memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom and do as they've been told, I will guard and remember them."

source_sentence: 梵天王及諸梵天俱白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The Brahma Kings and Brahmakāyika gods all said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行，我等亦當護念。」
translation: If good men and good women memorize and recite the prajñāpāramitā and do as they've been told, we will also guard and remember them."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「希有，世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām said to the Buddha, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，得如是現世功德。
translation: Good sons and good women, accepting and reciting the perfection of wisdom will attain such merits in the present life.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若受持般若波羅蜜者，則為受持諸波羅蜜。」
translation: If someone retains the perfection of wisdom, then they retain the perfections."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 受持般若波羅蜜者，則為受持諸波羅蜜。
translation: "When someone retains the perfection of wisdom, they retain the perfections.

source_sentence: 復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜所得功德，汝今善聽，當為汝說。」
translation: Good sons and good women, this is the merit gained by retaining and reciting the perfection of wisdom, so listen well now, and I will explain it for you."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因受教而聽。
translation: Śakrodevānāmī accepted the teaching and listened.

source_sentence: 佛告憍尸迦：「若有欲毀亂違逆我此法者，雖有是心，漸漸自滅，終不從願。
translation: The Buddha told Kauśika, "If someone wants to disrupt or violate this teaching of mine, then even though they have this intention, it will gradually cease on its own, and they will never follow his vow.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，種種毀亂違逆事起，法應皆滅，是故此人終不從願。
translation: If good men and good women were to memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom, all sorts of disruptive and immoral things would arise and the Dharma would cease, so this person would never follow their vows.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，得如是現世功德。
translation: "Good sons and good women, accepting and reciting prajñā-pāramitā will attain such merits in the present life.

source_sentence: 譬如有藥名為摩醯，有蛇飢行求食，見有小虫而欲食之，虫赴藥所，蛇聞藥氣，即迴還去。
translation: Suppose there's a medicine named Mahêśvara, and a snake walks around hungry for food and sees a small bug that wants to eat it, and the bug goes to the medicine, and the snake hears the medicine's breath and turns around and goes back.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 藥力能消蛇毒故。
translation: The power of medicine can kill snake venom.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人亦如是，若受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，種種毀亂違逆事起，以般若波羅蜜力故，即自消滅。
translation: "Good sons and good women, likewise, if they retain and recite the perfection of wisdom, the various disruptive and immoral things that arise will cease on their own because of the power of the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，護世四天王皆當護念。
translation: If they memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom, the four heavenly kings who protect the world will guard and remember them.

source_sentence: 復次，憍尸迦！
translation: Again, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是人終不說無益之語，有所言說，人所信受，少於瞋恚，終不懷恨，不為我慢所覆，不為瞋恚所使。
translation: That person never speaks useless words, speaks something that's believed, has little anger, never bears a grudge, isn't hindered by pride, and isn't motivated by anger.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人若瞋恚時，能作是念：『若我瞋者，則壞諸根，顏色變異。
translation: Good sons and good women who are angry can think, 'If I were angry, it would destroy my faculties and change my appearance.

source_sentence: 我欲求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，云何當隨瞋心？』
translation: I want to pursue unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, so why should I follow anger?'

source_sentence: 如是思惟，即得正念。
translation: When you thus contemplate it, you'll attain right mindfulness.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，亦得是現世功德。」
translation: Good sons and good women, this is also the merit in the present life that comes from memorizing and reciting the perfection of wisdom."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「希有，世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānāmī said to the Buddha, "Rarely, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜為迴向故，不為高心。」
translation: The perfection of wisdom is for dedication of merit, not for lofty intentions."

source_sentence: 佛告憍尸迦：「善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，若入軍陣，誦般若波羅蜜，若住若出，若失壽命，若被惱害，無有是處；若刀箭向者，終不能傷。
translation: The Buddha told Kauśika, "Good sons and good women, if you memorize and recite the prajñāpāramitā, if you enter an army formation and recite the prajñpāramitā, there's no place for it if you stand or leave, if you lose your life, or if you're harmed; if a sword or arrow is pointed at you, you'll never be harmed.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜是大呪術、無上呪術。
translation: Prajñāpāramitā is a great, unsurpassed dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，學此呪術，不自念惡，不念他惡，不兩念惡；學是呪術，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，得薩婆若智，能觀一切眾生心。
translation: Good sons and good women, when they learn this spell, they won't be mindful of their own evil, won't be mindful of the evil of others, and won't be mindful of evil of both; when they learn this spell, they'll attain supreme perfect enlightenment, attain the knowledge of sarvajña, and be able to contemplate the minds of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若般若波羅蜜經卷住處若讀誦處，人若非人，不得其便；唯除業行，必應受者。
translation: "If there's a place to live or a place to recite a roll of the Prajñāpāramitā-sūtra, neither humans nor non-humans will have access to it; except for karmic actions, they will surely accept it.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 譬如道場四邊，若人若畜生，無能惱者。
translation: "It's like the four sides of the site of enlightenment, where there's nothing to disturb, whether it's a human or an animal.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 過去、未來、現在諸佛，此中得道，已得、今得、當得；是處一切眾生，無恐無畏，無能惱害。
translation: "The buddhas of the past, future, and present have attained the path here, have attained it now, and will attain it in the future; everywhere, all sentient beings have no fear or trepidation and are unable to be harmed.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 以般若波羅蜜故，是處則吉，人所恭敬供養禮拜。」
translation: Because of the perfection of wisdom, this place is fortunate, and people respect and offer support and veneration to it."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，書般若波羅蜜，受持經卷，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，以好花香、瓔珞、塗香、燒香、末香、雜香、繒蓋、幢幡，而以供養。
translation: Suppose a good man or woman writes prajñāpāramitā, accepts and memorizes a sūtra scroll, makes offerings, respects and praises it, and makes offerings with scents of good flowers, jewelry, perfume, burning incense, powdered incense, mixed incense, silken canopies, and banners.

source_sentence: 若復有人，以如來舍利，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，以好花香、瓔珞、塗香、燒香、末香、雜香、繒蓋、幢幡，而以供養。
translation: Suppose another person makes offerings to and respects the Tathāgata's relics, venerates and praises them, and makes offerings with good flowers, jewelry, coated incense, burning incense, powdered incense, mixed incense, silken canopies, and banners.

source_sentence: 其福何所為多？」
translation: How great would be their merit?"

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 我還問汝，隨汝意答。
translation: "I'll ask you again, and I'll answer as you like.

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 如來行何道得薩婆若所依止身，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提？」
translation: What path does the Tathāgata follow to attain the body upon which Sāvajña relies and attain supreme perfect enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來學般若波羅蜜故，得是身，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: As a result of training in the perfection of wisdom, the Tathāgata attains this body and attains supreme perfect enlightenment."

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 佛不以身故，名為如來；以得薩婆若故，名為如來。
translation: A Buddha isn't called a Tathāgata because of his body, but he's called a Tathāgata because he has attained sarvajña.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 諸佛薩婆若，從般若波羅蜜生，是身薩婆若智所依止故。
translation: "All the buddha-saṃjñas arise from the perfection of wisdom, and it's because of this body that the wisdom of the saṃjñas depends on.

source_sentence: 如來因是身得薩婆若智，成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，是身薩婆若所依止故，我滅度後舍利得供養。
translation: Because the Tathāgata attained the wisdom of sarvajñas because of this body, he attained supreme perfect enlightenment, and because this body is the basis for sarvajñas, the relics of my life will be offered to him after my extinction.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，書般若波羅蜜，受持讀誦，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，以好花香、瓔珞、塗香、燒香、末香、雜香、繒蓋、幢幡，而以供養，是善男子、善女人，即是供養薩婆若智。
translation: "If good men and good women write prajñāpāramitā, memorize and recite it, make offerings, respect and praise it, and make offerings with scents of good flowers, jewelry, perfume, burning incense, powdered incense, mixed incense, silken canopies, and banners, this is a good man or woman who makes offerings to the wisdom of the sarvajñas.

source_sentence: 是故若人書寫般若波羅蜜，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，當知是人得大福德。
translation: Therefore, if someone writes prajñā-pāramitā, makes offerings, respects, and praises it, that person should be known to have attained great merit.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 供養薩婆若智故。」
translation: It's because of the wisdom of making offerings to Sāvajñā."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 閻浮提人不供養恭敬尊重讚歎般若波羅蜜，為不知得如是大利益耶？」
translation: Why don't people in Jambudvīpa make offerings, revere, respect, and praise Prajñāparamit, not knowing that they'll receive such great benefit?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 閻浮提有幾所人於佛得不壞信？
translation: How many people in Jambudvīpa have attained indestructible faith in the Buddha?

source_sentence: 幾所人於法、於僧得不壞信？」
translation: How many people have indestructible faith in the Dharma and Saṃgha?"

source_sentence: 釋提桓因言：「少所人於佛得不壞信，於法、於僧得不壞信。
translation: Śakrodevānām said, "A few people attain indestructible faith in the Buddha and indestructible faith in the Dharma and Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 閻浮提少所人得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢。
translation: A few people in Jambudvīpa attain stream entry, sakṛd-āgāmin, non-returner, and arhat.

source_sentence: 得辟支佛者，轉復減少。
translation: Those who attain pratyekabuddhahood will again diminish.

source_sentence: 能行菩薩道者，亦復轉少。」
translation: Those who can practice the bodhisattva path also become fewer again."

source_sentence: 「如是，如是！
translation: "So it is!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 閻浮提少所人於佛得不壞信，乃至能發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，行菩薩道者，亦復轉少。
translation: It's also true that there are few people in Jambudvīpa who attain indestructible faith in the Buddha, even those who can arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and practice the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 無量無邊阿僧祇眾生，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，於中若一若二住阿毘跋致地。
translation: Measureless and limitless are the incalculable number of sentient beings who arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment and abide in the ground of abhidharma whether it's one or two.

source_sentence: 是故當知，善男子、善女人，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，乃至能受持讀誦、供養恭敬、尊重讚歎般若波羅蜜。
translation: Therefore, you should know that good sons and good women who arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment up to the point of accepting, reciting, making offerings, respecting, and praising prajñāparamitra are capable of doing so.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是人作是念：『過去諸佛行菩薩道時從是中學，我等亦應於是中學。
translation: That person thinks, 'This is how the buddhas of the past learned when they practiced the bodhisattva path, and this is how we should learn.

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜是我大師。』
translation: The perfection of wisdom is my great teacher.'

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若我現在，若我滅後，菩薩常應依止般若波羅蜜。
translation: "If I were to die now or after I die, bodhisattvas should always rely on the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，於我滅後，以供養如來故，起七寶塔；盡其形壽，以好花香、塗香、末香、衣服、幢幡，供養是塔。
translation: Suppose good men and good women, after I cease, build a seven-jewel stūpa in order to support the Tathāgata and spend their whole lives making offerings to this stūpa with scents of good flowers, perfumes, incense, clothing, and banners and flags.

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，以是因緣故，得福多不？」
translation: Are these good men and good women who, because of these causes, have attained much merit?"

source_sentence: 釋提桓因言：「甚多，世尊！」
translation: Śakrodevānām said, "Very much, Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，供養般若波羅蜜經卷，恭敬尊重讚歎，以好華香、塗香、末香、衣服、幢幡，而以供養，其福甚多。
translation: If good men and good women make offerings to the Prajñāpāramitā scrolls, respect, honor, and praise them, and make offerings with nice flowers, perfume, powdered incense, clothing, and banners, their merits will be great.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 置是一塔，若滿閻浮提七寶塔，善男子、善女人，盡其形壽，以好華香乃至伎樂，供養是塔。

source_sentence: 阿難言：「不也！
translation: Ānanda said, "No!

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是故般若波羅蜜為五波羅蜜導。
translation: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is the guide for the five perfections.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 譬如大地種散其中，因緣和合即得生長，不依此地終不得生。
translation: It's like the seeds of the earth scattered throughout it, which grow when causes and conditions combine, but never come into being unless they rely on this place.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是五波羅蜜，住般若波羅蜜中而得增長，為般若波羅蜜所護故，得向薩婆若。
translation: Thus, these five perfections abide in the perfection of wisdom and attain growth, and because they are protected by the perfection of wisdom, they can advance to sarvajña.

source_sentence: 是故，阿難！
translation: Therefore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜為五波羅蜜作導。」
translation: Perfection of Wisdom is a guide for the five perfections."

source_sentence: 爾時釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行，所得功德，如來說之猶亦未盡。」
translation: These are good sons and good women who retain, recite, and practice prajñāpāramit just as described, and the merits they attain are still not exhausted when the Tathāgata explains them."

source_sentence: 佛告憍尸迦：「我不但說是人受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行功德。
translation: The Buddha told Kauśika, "I'm not just saying that person retains, recites, and recites the prajñāparamitā according to the merits of their actions as described.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，供養般若波羅蜜經卷，恭敬尊重讚歎，以好華香乃至幢幡，我亦說其所得功德。」
translation: If there are good men and good women who make offerings to the Prajñāpāramitā scrolls, respect and venerate them, and praise them with nice flowers and incense and even banners, I'll also explain the merits they'll obtain."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānāmī said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我亦當護念是善男子、善女人，供養般若波羅蜜經卷，恭敬尊重讚歎，以好華香乃至幢幡者。」
translation: I will also guard and remember this good man or woman who makes offerings to the Prajñāpāramitā scrolls, honors and respects them, and praises them with nice flowers and incense and even banners and streamers."

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，受持讀誦般若波羅蜜。
translation: "Good men and good women, they memorize and recite the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 若干百千諸天大眾，為聽法故，來至其所。
translation: Hundreds of thousands of gods and goddesses come to them because they want to hear the teaching.

source_sentence: 是法師為諸天說法時，非人益其氣力。
translation: When this Dharma teacher teaches the Dharma to the gods, no one else benefits from his or her energy.

source_sentence: 若法師疲極，不樂說法，諸天恭敬法故，令其樂說。
translation: If the Dharma teacher is too tired to happily expound the Dharma, the gods respect the Dharma and make him happy to expound it.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是亦善男子、善女人得是現世功德。
translation: This is also the kind of merit that good men and good women attain in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，於四眾中說般若波羅蜜時，其心不畏有來難問及詰責者。
translation: "Good men and good women, when they teach the perfection of wisdom among the four groups, their minds aren't afraid to ask difficult questions and interrogate those who come.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是人為般若波羅蜜護念故，不見有人得般若波羅蜜短者，般若波羅蜜亦無短可得。
translation: "Because a person protects the mindfulness of the perfection of wisdom, they don't see anyone who's short of the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom has no shortcomings to attain.

source_sentence: 是人如是為般若波羅蜜護念故，無畏有來難問詰責者。
translation: Because that person thus protects the mindfulness of the perfection of wisdom, they have no fear of being questioned or interrogated by someone who comes.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是亦善男子、善女人現世功德。
translation: This is also the merit of good men and good women in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，讀誦般若波羅蜜故，為父母所愛，為宗親、知識、沙門、婆羅門所敬，衰惱鬪訟，如法能度。
translation: "Good men and good women who recite the perfection of wisdom are loved by their parents, respected by their clansmen and friends, ascetics, and priests, and are capable of overcoming disputes and quarrels according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是亦善男子、善女人現世功德。
translation: This is also the merit of good men and good women in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜經卷所住處，四天王天上諸天，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心者，皆來至般若波羅蜜所，受持讀誦，供養作禮而去。
translation: "Where the Prajñāpāramitā scroll resides, the gods in the Heaven of the Four Heavenly Kings who have aroused the mind of unsurpassed, corrected, and perfected enlightenment all come to Prajñāpāramitā, receive it, recite it, make offerings, pay homage, and depart.

source_sentence: 忉利天、夜摩天、兜率陀天、化樂天、他化自在天上諸天，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心者，皆來至般若波羅蜜所，受持讀誦，供養作禮而去。
translation: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials, the Yama Heaven, the Tuṣita Heaven, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven are all filled with people who have aroused the mind of unsurpassed, corrected, recited, made offerings, and paid homage to Prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 梵天、梵世天、梵輔天、梵眾天、大梵天、光天、少光天、無量光天、光音天、淨天、少淨天、無量淨天、遍淨天、無陰行天、福生天、廣果天、無廣天、無熱天、妙見天、善見天、無小天上諸天，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心者，皆來至般若波羅蜜所，受持讀誦，供養作禮而去。
translation: The Brahma gods, Brahmā Sahaṃpati gods, Brahmā Sahaṃpati gods, Brahmā Sahaṃpati gods, Luminous gods, Less Luminous gods, Limitless Luminous gods, Luminous Sound gods, Pure gods, Less Pure gods, Limitless Pure gods, Universally Pure gods, Aggregate Formation gods, Blessed Birth gods, Vast Fruit gods, Vastless gods, Heatless gods, Wonderful Vision gods, Good Vision gods, and Formless Celestial gods all come to the perfection of wisdom, receive it, recite it, make offerings, pay homage, and depart.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦。
translation: Kauśika.

source_sentence: 汝勿謂但有無小天為供養般若波羅蜜故來。
translation: Don't say that there are only a handful of gods who come because they want to support the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 三千大千世界中欲、色界諸天，發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心者，皆來至般若波羅蜜所，受持讀誦，供養作禮而去。
translation: All the gods of the desire and form realms in the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds who have aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment come to the perfection of wisdom, receive its maintenance, recite it, make offerings, pay homage, and depart.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，應作是念：『十方無量阿僧祇國土中，所有諸天、龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、人、非人，是等來至般若波羅蜜所，受持、讀誦、供養、作禮時，我當以般若波羅蜜法施。』
translation: Good sons and good women, you should think, 'When all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans in the countless incalculable lands of the ten directions come to the perfection of wisdom to receive, recite, make offerings, and venerate it, I will give them the Dharma gift of the perfection of wisdom.'

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，般若波羅蜜經卷所住處，若殿堂、若房舍，無能毀壞，除先行業必應受者。
translation: Good sons and good women, suppose there's a hall or a dwelling where a scroll of the Perfection of Wisdom scripture lives that can't be damaged and that you must accept it except for prior actions.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 亦是善男子、善女人現世功德。」
translation: They are also the merits of good men and good women in the present life."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，云何知諸天來受持、讀誦、供養、禮敬般若波羅蜜時？」
translation: Good sons and good women, how do you know when gods come to receive, recite, make offerings to, and venerate the perfection of wisdom?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，見大光明，必知天、龍、夜叉、乾闥婆等，來至其所。
translation: If good sons and good women see that great radiance, they surely will know that gods, dragons, yakṣas, and gandharvas are coming to their places.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，若聞殊異之香，必知諸天來至其所。
translation: "Good sons and good women, if they hear a distinctive fragrance, they will know that the gods have come to them.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，所住之處，應令淨潔；以淨潔故，非人皆大歡喜，來到其所。
translation: "Good sons and good women, make sure that the place where you live is clean, and because it's clean, non-people will be overjoyed to come to it.

source_sentence: 是中先住小鬼，不堪大力諸天威德故，皆悉避去；隨大力諸天數數來故，其心轉樂大法。
translation: Those brats who previously lived there were all avoided because they couldn't stand the might of the powerful gods, and their minds were transformed by the countless visits of the powerful gods, who were delighted with the great teaching.

source_sentence: 是故所住處，四邊不應令有臭穢不淨。
translation: That's why the four sides of their abode shouldn't be made smelly and impure.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，身不疲極，臥起安隱，不見惡夢。
translation: "Good sons and good women, when they're not physically exhausted and when they're lying down and at ease, they don't see bad dreams.

source_sentence: 若其夢時，但見諸佛、諸佛塔廟，阿羅漢眾、諸菩薩眾，修習六波羅蜜，學薩婆若，淨佛世界。
translation: When they dream, they see buddhas, stūpas, arhats, and bodhisattvas cultivating the six perfections, training in sarvajña, and purifying the Buddha-realm.

source_sentence: 又聞佛名，某甲佛於某方某國，與若干百千萬億眾，恭敬圍遶而為說法。
translation: They also hear the name of a certain Buddha in a certain country in a certain direction, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of millions of people who respectfully explain the Dharma to them.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，夢中所見如是，覺已安樂，氣力充足，身體輕便。
translation: "Good men and good women, this is what they see in their dreams, which makes them feel comfortable, gives them plenty of energy, and makes them physically relaxed.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人，不貪飲食。
translation: This is a good man or good woman who doesn't crave food and drink.

source_sentence: 譬如坐禪比丘，從三昧起，以學禪故，不貪飲食。
translation: It's like a monk sitting in meditation who rises from samādhi and doesn't crave food and drink because he's training in meditation.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 非人益其氣力故。
translation: "It's because no one benefits from their energy.

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人，欲得如是等現世功德，當受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行。
translation: Good sons and good women, if you want to attain such merit in the present life, you must accept, recite, and practice prajñāpāramit just as described.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 善男子、善女人若不能受持讀誦般若波羅蜜，如所說行，當書寫經卷，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，以好華香、塗香、末香、燒香、雜香，衣服、幢幡、伎樂供養。」
translation: Good sons and good women who are unable to retain and recite the perfection of wisdom and conduct themselves as instructed should write down the sūtra scrolls, make offerings, venerate, respect, and praise them, and make offerings with good floral, coated, powdered, burning, and mixed incense, as well as with clothing, banners, streamers, and music."

source_sentence: 摩訶般若波羅蜜舍利品第五
translation: Fifth Chapter of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-śāriputra Sutra

source_sentence: 爾時佛告釋提桓因言：「憍尸迦！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakrodevān, saying, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 滿閻浮提舍利以為一分，般若波羅蜜經卷以為一分。
translation: The relics of Jambudvīpa take one part, and the Prajñāpāramitā scroll takes one part.

source_sentence: 二分之中，為取何分？」
translation: Of these two parts, what part should we take?"

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我取般若波羅蜜。
translation: "I'll take the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於舍利非不恭敬，以舍利從般若波羅蜜生故，般若波羅蜜所熏，故得供養。
translation: "I don't disrespect the Śāriputra because it arises from the perfection of wisdom and is perfumed by the perfection of wisdom, so I can make offerings to it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於忉利天上善法堂中，我有坐處，忉利諸天子來供養我故。
translation: 'In the hall of the good Dharma in the Heaven of the Thirty-three, I have a place to sit, and the children of the Thirty-three gods come to make offerings to me.

source_sentence: 若我不在座上，諸天子為我坐處，作禮恭敬，遶已而去，作是念：『釋提桓因於此處坐，為忉利諸天說法。』
translation: If I'm not on the seat, the gods pay homage and respect to me where I'm sitting, go around and leave, thinking, 'Śakra Devānām-Indra is sitting here, teaching the Dharma for the gods of the Thirty-three.'

source_sentence: 諸佛舍利亦如是，從般若波羅蜜生，薩婆若所依止，故得供養。
translation: *So it is with the Buddha's relics, which are born from the perfection of wisdom and are supported by the sarvajñas, and therefore can be offered up.

source_sentence: 是故，世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於二分之中，取般若波羅蜜。
translation: "Within these two parts, I grasp the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 置滿閻浮提舍利，若滿三千大千世界舍利以為一分，般若波羅蜜經卷以為一分。
translation: "Suppose I were to fill one part of the relics of Jambudvīpa with relics from the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds and one part of the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra scroll with relics from the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 二分之中，我取般若波羅蜜。
translation: Of those two parts, I'll take Prajñāpradīpa-mātra.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛舍利，因般若波羅蜜生，故得供養。
translation: The relics of the buddhas are offered because they were produced from the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 譬如負債人，常畏債主，以得親近奉事王故，債主反更恭敬怖畏。
translation: "Suppose a person in debt always fears his creditor, but because he's been able to serve the king intimately, the creditor becomes more respectful and fearful.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 依恃國王，其力大故。
translation: Relying on a king, his power is great.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 舍利亦如是，依止般若波羅蜜，故得供養。
translation: *So it is with Śāriputra, for he relies on the perfection of wisdom and thus attains offerings.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜如王，舍利如親近王人。
translation: Prajñāpāramitā is like a king, and a relic is like someone who's close to the king.

source_sentence: 如來舍利，依止一切智慧，故得供養。
translation: The Tathāgata's relics rely on all wisdom, so they can be offered up.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸佛一切智慧亦從般若波羅蜜生，是故我於二分之中，取般若波羅蜜。
translation: All of the buddhas' wisdom also arises from the perfection of wisdom, so I therefore take the perfection of wisdom from both parts.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 譬如無價寶珠，有如是功德。
translation: It's like a priceless precious pearl with such qualities.

source_sentence: 其所住處，非人不能得其便。
translation: Where it stands, it's not accessible to non-humans.

source_sentence: 若男若女，若大若小，為非人所持，寶珠至其處，非人則去。
translation: Whether male or female, large or small, it's held by a non-humans, and when the precious pearl reaches it, the non-humans leave.

source_sentence: 若有熱病，珠能除滅。
translation: If he has a feverish illness, the pearl will remove it.

source_sentence: 若有風病，以珠著身上，風患即除。
translation: If you have a windstorm, put a pearl on your body, and the windstorm will go away.

source_sentence: 若有冷病，以珠著身上，冷患亦除。
translation: If you have a cold illness, put a pearl on your body, and the coldness will go away.

source_sentence: 是珠住處，夜時能為明，熱時能為涼，寒時能為溫。
translation: Where these pearls reside, they can make things light at night, cool things when they're hot, and warm things when they're cold.

source_sentence: 珠所住處，蛇毒不入。
translation: Where the pearl dwells, snake venom won't enter.

source_sentence: 若男若女，若大若小，為毒虫所螫，以珠示之，毒即除滅。
translation: If a man or woman, large or small, gets stung by a venomous insect, show it to him or her with a pearl, and the poison will go away.

source_sentence: 若諸目患，以珠著目上，目患即除。
translation: If someone with eyesight problems puts a pearl on their eyes, the eyesight problems will be removed.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 又是寶珠，若著水中，與水同色；若以白繒裹著水中，水色即白；若以青、黃、紫、赤種種色繒裹著水中，水即各隨其色，水濁即為清。
translation: Also, if this precious pearl is placed in water, it'll be the same color as the water; if it's wrapped in white silk, the water's color will be white; if it's wrapped in blue, yellow, purple, or red silk, the water will follow its color, and the water will be clear when it's turbid.

source_sentence: 是珠成就如是功德。」
translation: This pearl achieves this kind of virtue."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難問釋提桓因：「此是閻浮提寶？
translation: Ānanda then asked Śakra Devānām-Indra, "Is this the jewel of Jambudvīpa?

source_sentence: 為是天上寶？」
translation: Why is it a heavenly jewel?"

source_sentence: 釋提桓因言：「此是天上寶。
translation: Śakrodevānām said, "This is a treasure from heaven.

source_sentence: 閻浮提人，亦有是寶，但功德少而重。
translation: The people of Jambudvīpa also have this treasure, but it's of little merit and heavy.

source_sentence: 天上寶珠，功德多而輕。
translation: The jewels in the heavens are numerous in merit but light in weight.

source_sentence: 人寶比天寶，算數譬喻所不能及。
translation: A human treasure is comparable to a heavenly treasure, and it's beyond the power of calculation and metaphors.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若是珠在篋中，雖舉珠去，以珠功德故，其篋則貴。
translation: "If a pearl is in a container, then even though it's lifted and removed, the container will be valuable because of the pearl's merit.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以般若波羅蜜薩婆若智功德故，如來滅後，舍利得供養。
translation: It's because of the merit of the prajñāpāramitā knowledge that relics can be offered up after the Tathāgata's death.

source_sentence: 以如來舍利，是薩婆若智所住處故。
translation: It's because the Tathāgata's relics are the place where the wisdom of the sarvajñas resides.

source_sentence: 我於二分之中，取般若波羅蜜。
translation: Of the two parts, I'll take the perfection of prajñā.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 置是滿三千大千世界舍利，若滿如恒河沙等世界中舍利以為一分，般若波羅蜜經卷以為一分。
translation: "Suppose I were to fill up the relics of 3,000 great thousand worlds with one part of the relics of a world like the Ganges River Sands, and I were to take one part of the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra scroll.

source_sentence: 二分之中，我取般若波羅蜜。
translation: Of those two parts, I'll take the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛如來薩婆若智，皆從般若波羅蜜生，薩婆若所熏，故舍利得供養。
translation: The wisdom of the buddha-tathāgatas and sarvajñas all arises from the perfection of wisdom, and it's perfumed by sarvajñas that makes offerings to Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 「復次，世尊！
translation: "Furthermore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，欲如實見十方無量阿僧祇諸佛者，當行般若波羅蜜，當修般若波羅蜜。」
translation: If good sons and good women want to truly see the incalculable buddhas of the ten directions, they should practice prajñā-pāramitā and cultivate prajñā-pāramitā."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 過去諸佛，皆因般若波羅蜜，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提；未來諸佛，亦因般若波羅蜜，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提；現在十方無量阿僧祇世界諸佛，亦因般若波羅蜜，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: All the buddhas of the past attained unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment because of the perfection of wisdom; all the buddhas of the future will attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment because of the perfection of wisdom; and all the buddhas of the incalculable incalculable world in the ten directions will attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment because of the perfection of wisdom."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 摩訶波羅蜜是般若波羅蜜，佛因是般若波羅蜜，皆知一切眾生心、心所行。」
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā is prajñāpāramitā, and because it's prajñāpāramitā, the Buddha knows the minds and mental functions of all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩長夜行般若波羅蜜故。」
translation: It's because the bodhisattvas Mahāsattvas practice prajñāpāramitā throughout the night."

source_sentence: 釋提桓因白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 菩薩但行般若波羅蜜，不行餘波羅蜜耶？」
translation: Do bodhisattvas simply practice the perfection of wisdom and not the rest of the perfection of wisdom?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 菩薩皆行六波羅蜜。
translation: "Bodhisattvas all practice the six perfections.

source_sentence: 若布施時，般若波羅蜜為上首；若持戒、若忍辱、若精進、若禪定、若觀諸法時，般若波羅蜜為上首。
translation: When it comes to generosity, the perfection of wisdom is paramount; when it comes to observing precepts, forbearance, effort, meditation, and contemplation of phenomena, the perfection of wisdom is paramount.

source_sentence: 譬如閻浮提種種樹、種種形、種種色、種種葉、種種華、種種果，其陰皆一，無有差別。
translation: It's like the various trees, forms, colors, leaves, flowers, and fruits of Jambudvīpa, whose aggregates are all the same, with no distinctions.

source_sentence: 五波羅蜜亦如是，入般若波羅蜜中無有差別。」
translation: Similarly, the five perfections enter into the perfection of prajñā without distinction."

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是般若波羅蜜，有大功德，有無量無邊功德，有無等等功德。
translation: "This perfection of wisdom has great merit, immeasurable and limitless merit, and incalculable virtue.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人寫般若波羅蜜經卷，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，以好華香乃至幢幡；若復有人寫般若波羅蜜經卷與他人。
translation: Suppose someone writes a scroll of the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra and offers it to someone else with offerings, respect, praise, and nice flowers, incense, and banners; suppose someone writes a scroll of the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra and gives it to another person.

source_sentence: 是二功德，何所為多？」
translation: What would be the great merit of these two?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 我還問汝，隨意答我。
translation: "I'll ask you again, and you can answer me as you like.

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 若有人得佛舍利，但自供養；若復有人得佛舍利自供養，亦與他人令供養。
translation: Suppose someone obtains a Buddha's relics and simply makes offerings to themselves; suppose another person obtains a Buddha's relics and makes offerings to themselves and to others.

source_sentence: 是二功德，何所為多？」
translation: What would be the great merit of these two?"

source_sentence: 釋提桓因言：「世尊！
translation: Śakrodevānām said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若人得佛舍利自供養，亦與他人令供養，其福甚多。」
translation: If a person obtains a Buddha's relics to make offerings to themselves and gives them to others to make offerings to them, their merit will be great."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，寫般若波羅蜜經卷，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎，以好花香乃至幢幡；不如善男子、善女人，寫般若波羅蜜經卷，自供養，亦與他人令供養，其福甚多。」
translation: If a good man or woman writes a scroll of the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra and offers it up in respect and admiration, with nice flowers and fragrances and even banners, it wouldn't be as good as a good man or woman who writes a scroll of the Prajñāpāramitā sūtra, makes offerings to himself or herself, and makes offerings to others, which would be very meritorious."

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，在在處處為人解說般若波羅蜜，其福甚多。」
translation: If good men and good women explain the perfection of wisdom to others everywhere, their merit will be great."

source_sentence: 小品般若經卷第二
translation: Small Chapter Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra, Volume 2
